Partner Interface
No negative impact?
After discovering carpet tile in Europe in the early 1970s, Ray C. Anderson recognised its future in modern Mission possible. o ces. Open plan o ce systems were emerging, bringing with them the need to easily access at wire and Walker duct systems – state of the art infrastructure at the time. In 1973, Ray founded Interface in LaGrange, GA, bringing the concept of free lay carpet tile to America and beginning a revolution in com- mercial oorcovering.
Interface entered the 21st century and delivered one innovation after another. In 2000 they rede ned modular carpet with the introduction of Entropy® and the emerging i2® category of products. That same year they o ered the rst commercial carpet collection to use recycled nylon in the face ber and a 100% recycled content vinyl backing layer.
Over their 25-year sustainability journey, they’ve evolved their thinking and approach. Originally, they focused only on reducing environmental impacts, but that evolved to include social impacts and new business models.
In 1994, inspired by their customers, they set out to eliminate their negative impact on the environment. Today, Interface is proud to have delivered on Mission Zero® commitment, in part by becoming the rst global ooring manufacturer to sell all products as carbon neutral across their full life cycle.
Along the way, they’ve learned a thing or two about business models, solving 09 material challenges and shooting for the moon.
